# Get Started with F#

> Getting started with F# development using Visual Studio, VS Code, or the .NET CLI. F# works on Windows, macOS, and Linux with full .NET ecosystem support. Choose your preferred editor and follow the setup guide to create your first F# application.

*Topics available: 5*

- [Get started with F# with command-line tools](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/fsharp/get-started/get-started-command-line.md): Learn how to build a simple multi-project solution on F# using the .NET CLI on any operating system (Windows, macOS, or Linux).
- [Get started with F# in Visual Studio](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/fsharp/get-started/get-started-visual-studio.md): Learn how to use F# with Visual Studio.
- [Get Started with F# in Visual Studio Code](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/fsharp/get-started/get-started-vscode.md): Learn how to use F# with Visual Studio Code and the Ionide plugin suite.
- [Get started with F#](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/fsharp/get-started/index.md): Find out how to get started with the F# programming language.
- [Install F#](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/fsharp/get-started/install-fsharp.md): Learn how to install F# in various different ways.
